main event: A police officer and his wife in Corvallis, Oregon spotted a bright, shooting star-like object in the sky in 1961.
interesting points: The object had a greenish-yellow-orange tail and appeared to be sparking.
The object was estimated to be 5-10 times larger than a typical shooting star.
The object dropped down behind a house, then went straight down and disappeared.
The police officer provided detailed information on the object's angle, azimuth, and movement.
sighted object: a bright, shooting star-like object with a colored tail and sparks
witnesses: a police officer and his wife
photographs: no photographs present in the report
